intro: Descurainia boryi, commonly known as the Bory's tansy, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many mustard plants. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender stems and small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and the plant is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides. Descurainia boryi is adapted to dry conditions and is sometimes considered an invasive species in certain areas.
